result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon T Aide

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Brandon T Aide in court.  Attorney Theresa L Lewandowski in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a hearing regarding pro se speedy trial demand in the 3 felony cases. DE is pro se, but does qualify for SPD. Court orders the State to provide a global resolution to the DE in writing in 2 weeks.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

3:08 PM Defendant Brandon T Aide in court.  ADA Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Re: Motion for Bail Bond Modification 
Statement by defendant in support of Motion for Modification. Objection to Motion by ADA Lee. Court does not amend cash at this time. All conditions remain the same.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

3:08 PM Defendant Brandon T Aide in court.  ADA Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for SPD and awaiting an attorney to be appointed. Defn has previoulsy waived time limits. STC scheduled.
Bail/bond hearing on October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:04 PM Defendant Brandon T Aide in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Lexi Keyes in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not retained counsel. Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SMM. 
- Defendant shall not have others contact SMM on behalf of the defendant. 
- Defendant shall not be within 500 feet of SMM. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

3:35 PM Defendant Brandon T Aide in court, in custody.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Brandon T Aide.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
